line_1: False and upbraided, he forsakes the Downs,
line_2: Nor courts her Smiles, nor fears the Ocean's Frown

line_1: The dusky woods, the open downs,
line_2: The winding brooks, the rising towns.

line_1: Loose, as the Breeze that plays along the Downs,
line_2: Great Store of Caps, of Slippers, and of Gowns;

line_1: Loose, as the Breeze that plays along the Downs,
line_2: And waves the Summer-Woods when Evening frowns.

line_1: Loose, as the Breeze that plays along the Downs,
line_2: But every flowing Limb in Pleasure drowns,

line_1: AS some grave Matron bred on rural Downs,
line_2: Who at the mention of a Top-knot frowns,

line_1: AS some grave Matron bred on rural Downs,
line_2: And the proud Minxes of the Market-Towns;
